data.title: Five Rivers MetroParks
data.meta_description: Mission To promote positive youth development education and leadership skills using an environmental foundation in a welcoming, safe, fun, active setting that utilizes volunteers and community resources with adult and youth interaction. Key Goals Positive youth development Improved academic behavior Fun, learning activities with a focus on nature, science and computer technology Developing life skills […]
data.text:
Adventure Central

2222 N. James H. McGee Blvd.

Dayton, OH 45417

reception@adventurecentral.org

Phone: (937) 278-2601

Fax: (937) 268-8428

Follow us on Facebook

Get Involved

The best way for new youth to get involved in Adventure Central programming is to attend our Activity Night programs that run Mondays from 7-8 PM during the school year, and include many of the same activities as the after-school program.

Make a tax-deductible, online contribution to Adventure Central right now:

Donate Now

Volunteer Opportunities

We always appreciate teen and adult volunteers and have opportunities for both episodic and long-term volunteers. There are many capacities in which volunteers could help, including homework assistance, assisting with programming and exhibit and grounds care. For volunteer/service learning opportunities, please come in or call (937) 278-2601.

Awards and Recognition

Promising Practices in Urban 4-H Science: Adventure Central was selected in 2011 as one of 16 4-H Youth Development programs from across the country by contributing to the development of a promising practices guide for 4-H Science in Urban Communities as part of a National 4-H initiative funded by the Noyce Foundation. The guide includes promising practices, case studies and suggested resources in each of 15 content areas — all with a focus on expanding the quality and quantity of out-of-school science programming.

The Adventure Central after-school program was also highlighted on the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services Youth.Gov site as part of their effort to provide a one-stop shop for information about federal youth programs and initiatives.
